result.execSummary:
The defendant Darin W. Belland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:44 p.m Defendant Darin W. Belland in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf246 and 16cf101. Richards states agreement. State moves to dismiss 16cf101 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Richards/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Fine - $500 plus costs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.

Cash bond posted in 16cf101 should be applied towards fine/costs in 15cf246.
Adj. 3:02 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:42 p.m. Defendant Darin W. Belland in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf246 and 16cf101. Richards - In receipt of complaint in 16cf101, waives further reading. Richards waives preliminary hearings in both cases. State - will file Informations in both cases that mirror complaints -   Defendant waives preliminary hearings. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. On understanding that Informations will mirror Complaints, Richards wishes to proceed to arraignment today. Richards enters not guilty pleas. Informations to be filed by close of business on April 26, 2016. Bail continued. Adj. 3:46 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

1:53 p.m. Defendant Derin W. Belland in court, in custody via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash  bond. Bond done on 16cf101- Court verifies spelling of defendant's first name "Darin". Warrant quashed in underlying case(165cf246) . Adj. 2:00 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
per Nicole at ONSO in custody ONSO
Extradition Forecast
Extradition Forecast

3:09 p.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Defendant does not appear. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance. Based on discussions with DA, believes a resolution is close. Based on notice to defendant at last court hearing and non-appearance, Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:11 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
- includes cover letter

3:44 p.m. Defendant Darin W. Belland in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 3:46 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-11-2015 03:45 pm

2:35 p.m. Defendant Darin W. Belland in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states defendant is eligible for PD but his office has conflict of interest-requests continuance. Bail continued. Adj. 2:37 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

2:07 p.m. Defendant Darin W. Belland in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance. Defendant states he was ill and has medical excuse.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Court quashes warrant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Voluntary appearance/Initial appearance at 11-09-2015 01:30 pm
